text: Psychrophrynella is a genus of frogs in the family Craugastoridae. Alternatively, it has been placed in the family Strabomantidae. The genus is distributed on the Andes of southern Peru and Bolivia. One of the four species assessed by the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) is assessed as "Critically Endangered". The name Psychrophrynella is a contraction of the Greek ' meaning cold and phrynos meaning toad, with the Greek diminutive suffix ella. It refers to their relatively cold habitats. ==Description== Psychrophrynella are small frogs measuring between snout–vent length. They are characterized by narrow head, absence of differentiated tympanic membrane (except in Psychrophrynella boettgeri) and, in most species, absence of tympanic annulus. Dorsum is smooth, granular, or shagreen. Venter is finely granular, granular, or coarsely granular (but smooth in Psychrophrynella pinguis). ==Species== The following species are recognised in the genus Psychrophrynella: ==References== Category:Craugastoridae Category:Amphibians of South America Category:Amphibian genera Category:Taxa named by Stephen Blair Hedges Category:Taxa named by William Edward Duellman
title: Psychrophrynella
